comments.body: I don't know which code is calling this function; did you check whether that code also needs to be adjusted?

@felixfontein - in short, no other changes required to the module.

The authors of the Pika library changed how their conn_channel.basic_publish worked.  Previously it returned errors or a tuple if successful.  They changed this to raising exceptions on errors instead, which, broke the `modules/notifications/rabbit_publish.py` module as it expected to evaluate on True or False.  Catching the success or failure here is perfectly fine as the module expects True or False.
Perfect. Just wanted to make sure nothing got forgotten :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +197,201 @@        try:
            self.conn_channel.basic_publish(**args)
            return True
        except pika.exceptions.UnroutableError:
            return False
